intro: Stenanthera hamata, commonly known as the hairy stellanthera, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces flowers in late spring to early summer. Stenanthera hamata is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful cultivation.
